str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To accompany, attend, follow. Properly, to be in the same way with, i.e. To accompany.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
From a (long) distance, afar. Adverb from makros; from a distance or afar.
A conjunction, preposition and adverb of continuance, until.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the same as aer; a yard; by implication, a mansion.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
High priest, chief priest. From arche and hiereus; the high-priest; by extension a chief priest.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.
Within, inside, with verbs either of rest or of motion; prep: within, to within, inside. From eis; inside.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To sit, be seated, enthroned; I dwell, reside. From kata; and hemai; to sit down; figuratively, to remain, reside.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From hupo and a derivative of eresso; an under-oarsman, i.e. subordinate.
Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) an end, (b) event or issue, (c) the principal end, aim, purpose, (d) a tax.
